items.message:
Levels on the River South Tyne at Alston and Featherstone have risen as a result of heavy rainfall overnight. Rainfall in the area is easing and river levels are currently expected to peak this afternoon. Consequently, flooding of low lying roads, riverside footpaths and farmland is possible between 11:00 and 16:00 today, 07/10/2022.  

We are closely monitoring the situation and we do not currently expect to issue any flood warnings. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses.  

This message will be updated by 17:00 on 07/10/2022, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message: River and lake levels will rise again today as a response to further rainfall.  The forecast is for rain this morning, heavy at times, which will lessen in intensity and frequency as the morning progresses. Rivers and Lakes levels will rise for a time as a result of the rain before peaking this afternoon. Derwent Water will remain high affecting low lying areas bordering the shores of Derwent Water.  Areas most at risk are the Upper Derwent from Seathwaite to Derwent Water. We continue to monitor levels closely and are clearing debris from weed screens in the area. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated tomorrow morning 08/10/2022, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers Greta, St Johns Beck and Bassenthwaite Lake

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Greta, St Johns Beck, Glendermackin

items.message:
River levels are rising on the Rivers Greta, St Johns Beck and Bassenthwaite Lake due to rainfall this morning.
Areas most at risk include River Derwent from Keswick to Bassenthwaite. The Rivers Greta, Glenderamackin and St Johns Beck including Keswick.
River levels will rise, peaking early afternoon when they will start to recede.
Further showers, some heavy are forecast this afternoon.
River levels are forecast to rise with a risk of flooding to low-lying land and roads.
We will continue to monitor levels closely.
Plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.
This message will be updated tomorrow 08/10/2022, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Cocker, River Marron, River Derwent

items.message: River and lake levels will rise again today as a response to further rainfall.  The forecast is for rain this morning, heavy at times, which will lessen in intensity and frequency as the morning progresses. Rivers and Lakes levels will rise for a time as a result of the rain before peaking this afternoon. Derwent Water will remain high affecting low lying areas bordering the shores of Derwent Water and the Keswick Camping and Caravan Club Site. We continue to monitor levels closely and are clearing debris from weed screens in the area. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated later today 07/10/2022 or as the situation changes.

River levels are rising steadily on the Walverden Water due to heavy rainfall.
Areas most at risk include Walverden Water comprising of properties off and including Bradley Road, Sagar Street, Brook Street, Southfield Street, Pendle Industrial Estate and Riverside Business Park.
Flooding is possible at Walverden Water comprising of properties off and including Bradley Road, Sagar Street, Brook Street, Southfield Street, Pendle Industrial Estate and Riverside Business Park from 01:30 PM on 07/10/2022.
Further rainfall is forecast this afternoon.
River levels are forecast to rise.
We will continue to monitor levels closely.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 08:30 PM on 07/10/2022, or as the situation changes.
